page.title: 08LOCAL TRANSPORT HISTORY
page.content: The{tracks}or{tramways}as they were called, were used to{carry heavy {trucks}pulled by{horses}or{men}from the{mine}to the nearest{canal}or {river.} The early{railway}tracks were made of{wood.}These tracks weren't really{efficient.} Men had been{experimenting}with {steam engines}and railway track. Within 25 years the land was criss-crossed with nearly{seven {thousand miles of working railways. {Stephenson's}famous{Liverpool}to {Manchester}line opened in{1830.} The old Victorian tracks which are near Navigation Gardens have been removed and have been put away by the side. These tracks are all{tatty}and{rusty.} Near the railway tracks is a{coal} mine. Railway tracks have{increased} throughout the area. {Little boys,}of {8 or 9 years}used to work on railways.
